text: Kampong Parit or Parit, also known as Serigan, is an area in Bandar Seri Begawan, the capital of Brunei, as well as a village-level subdivision in Kianggeh, a mukim (subdistrict) in Brunei-Muara District. The postcode for Kampong Parit is BA1912. It is home to Batu Satu commercial area, one of the capital's commercial areas, as well as a few of the Islamic religious education institutions in the country. == Name == Kampong Parit comes from the Malay name which translates as 'Parit Village'. == Commercial area == Batu Satu commercial area, located within Kampong Parit, comprises a cluster of shophouses, small-sized shopping centres and other commercial buildings. The businesses are mainly retail. There are also a few lodging establishments. == Educational institutions == Kampong Parit is home to a few of the institutions in the country which provide the Islamic religious education, mainly that which is taught in Arabic, namely: * Seri Begawan Religious Teachers University College, the teacher-training college which produces teachers for this education, mainly in religious primary schools * Hassanal Bolkiah Boys' Arabic Secondary School, the sixth form college for the Arabic Islamic religious education * Raja Isteri Pengiran Anak Damit Girls' Arabic Religious Secondary School, one of the few Arabic Islamic religious secondary schools * Bandar Seri Begawan Arabic Preparatory School, a preparatory school for entry into the secondary level of the Arabic Islamic religious education * Pengiran Anak Puteri Masna Religious School, a religious primary school for the compulsory Islamic religious education == References == Parit
title: Kampong Parit, Kianggeh
